member.name: T:Rebex.Net.Imap

member.remarks: All members of this class are thread-safe.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.CheckForUpdates(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes server notifications for the specified amount of time.
member.param: Duration of the idle interval, in milliseconds.
member.returns: True if any new notifications were received.

remarks.p: Notifications are generated when a new message arrives, when a message is deleted, when message flags change, etc. (see for a list of supported notifications).

These notifications can occur during a call to any method and are reported using the event. The method is useful when you need to check for any possible changes (reported using notifications) and do not wish to call any other method. Typically, a client application will call periodically while idle.
To receive the notifications itself, use the event.
This method represents IMAP NOOP or IDLE commands. IDLE is used whenever the server supports this command - see property. For duration values less than 10, NOOP is always used.

member.summary: Selects the specified folder so that its messages can be accessed.

Specifies whether the folder is to be selected as read-only.

remarks.p: The property will contain an instance of that represents the selected folder after a call to this method.
Only one mailbox can be selected at a time for a single connection, and only the messages in currently selected folder can be accessed. Also, most notifications only occur when a folder is selected.
This method represents IMAP SELECT and EXAMINE commands.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.Purge(Rebex.Net.ImapMessageSet)
member.summary: Permanently removes all messages marked as deleted (with a Deleted flag) from the current folder.
member.param: Message set comprised of message unique IDs to purge. Only supported by servers that support the UIDPLUS extension. Only the messages that are both present in the set and also have the Deleted flag set will be purged.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP EXPUNGE command.

This message set may be specified to ensure that the method does not remove any messages that have been marked as Deleted between the time that the user requested the purge operation and the time the server processes the command.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.SendCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes a command on the IMAP server.
member.param: Command (e.g. "CAPABILITY").
List of parameters. Allowed types are and a byte array.

remarks.p:
The specified string parameters are send as is. It is caller's responsibility to properly format the parameters.
The specified byte array parameters are send as literals - binary blocks of data.
To use this method properly, some understanding of the IMAP protocol is strongly recommended.
A call to SendCommand MUST be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.

member.summary: Returns the response of the IMAP server to the command.
member.returns: Response of the IMAP server.

remarks.p: Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to ReadResponse, the object will be in Reading state.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.GetMessages(Rebex.Net.ImapMessageSet,System.Action{Rebex.Net.ImapMessage})
member.summary: Downloads messages in the current folder that belong to a specified message set.
member.param: A set of messages.
A handler to process received messages. It has to process messages (and exit) quickly. If slow/complex processing is required, hand messages over to other thread.

remarks.para: Uses IMAP FETCH command to retrieve messages.
By default, this method marks messages as read. To prevent this behavior, set the to true.

This method demands a lot of data to be received from the server. The data has to be read from the network socket as fast as possible. This places demand on handler to process received messages as fast as possible. If the handler slows the process too much, incoming data will not be read from the underlying network socket in sufficient speed and TCP internal buffers will be overfilled. This can cause strange network exceptions.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.GetMessages(Rebex.Net.ImapMessageSet,Rebex.Net.ImapListFields,System.Action{Rebex.Net.ImapMessage})
member.summary: Downloads messages in the current folder that belong to a specified message set.
member.param: A set of messages.
Specifies the scope of information to determine about each message.
A handler to process received messages. It has to process messages (and exit) quickly. If slow/complex processing is required, hand messages over to other thread.

remarks.para: Uses IMAP FETCH command to retrieve messages.
By default, this method marks messages as read. To prevent this behavior, set the to true.

This method demands a lot of data to be received from the server. The data has to be read from the network socket as fast as possible. This places demand on handler to process received messages as fast as possible. If the handler slows the process too much, incoming data will not be read from the underlying network socket in sufficient speed and TCP internal buffers will be overfilled. This can cause strange network exceptions.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.CheckForUpdatesAsync(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous CheckForUpdates operation. Processes server notifications for the specified amount of time.
member.param: Duration of the idle interval, in milliseconds.

remarks.p: Notifications are generated when a new message arrives, when a message is deleted, when message flags change, etc. (see for a list of supported notifications).

These notifications can occur during a call to any method and are reported using the event. The method is useful when you need to check for any possible changes (reported using notifications) and do not wish to call any other method. Typically, a client application will call periodically while idle.
To receive the notifications itself, use the event.
This method represents IMAP NOOP or IDLE commands. IDLE is used whenever the server supports this command - see property. For duration values less than 10, NOOP is always used.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: True if any new notifications were received.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.CheckForUpdatesAsync(System.Object)

remarks.p: Notifications are generated when a new message arrives, when a message is deleted, when message flags change, etc. (see for a list of supported notifications).

These notifications can occur during a call to any method and are reported using the event. The method is useful when you need to check for any possible changes (reported using notifications) and do not wish to call any other method. Typically, a client application will call periodically while idle.
To receive the notifications itself, use the event.
This method represents IMAP NOOP command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: True if any new notifications were received.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.SubscribeAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Subscribe operation. Subscribes to a specified folder, adding it to a list of active folders that appear in the folder listings with set to .
member.param: Folder to subscribe to.

remarks.p: The only difference between those folders that are subscribed and those that aren't is that a call to using the ImapFolderListMode.Subscribed will only return the subscribed (active) folders. This has absolutely NOTHING to do with notifications.
This method represents IMAP SUBSCRIBE command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.UnsubscribeAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Unsubscribe operation. Unsubscribes from a specified folder, removing it to a list of active folders that appear in the folder listings with set to .
member.param: Folder to unsubscribe from.

remarks.p: The only difference between those folders that are subscribed and those that aren't is that a call to using the ImapFolderListMode.Subscribed will only return the subscribed (active) folders. This has absolutely NOTHING to do with notifications.
This method represents IMAP UNSUBSCRIBE command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.GetFolderInfoAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetFolderInfo operation. Returns information about the specified folder without selecting it.
member.param: Folder to retrieve information about.

remarks.p: Following properties are determined using this method: MessageCount, RecentCount, NotSeenCount, NextUniqueId and ValidityID.
This method represents IMAP STATUS command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A folder info.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.PurgeAsync(Rebex.Net.ImapMessageSet,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Purge operation. Permanently removes all messages marked as deleted (with a Deleted flag) from the current folder.
member.param: Message set comprised of message unique IDs to purge. Only supported by servers that support the UIDPLUS extension. Only the messages that are both present in the set and also have the Deleted flag set will be purged.

remarks.p: This method represents IMAP EXPUNGE command.

This message set may be specified to ensure that the method does not remove any messages that have been marked as Deleted between the time that the user requested the purge operation and the time the server processes the command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

The input stream.
Message flags.
IMAP message date/time.

remarks.p: Caution: Unlike the StoreMessage methods, StoreRawMessage does not parse the message to validate its structure and retrieve its date/time. User must ensure the stream supplied to this method represents a valid MIME format message.

The stream must contain data in MIME format, other formats are not supported. MIME files often have the '.eml' extension and are produced by Outlook Express. In contrast, Outlook produces '.msg' files that are not MIME files and therefore cannot be uploaded using this method.
This method represents IMAP APPEND command.
Unique ID of the message will be returned if the server supports the .UniqueIdPlus extension and it is enabled. See and .

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: Unique ID of the message, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the server does not support the UIDPLUS extension.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.SendCommandAsync(System.String,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous SendCommand operation. Executes a command on the IMAP server.
member.param: Command (e.g. "CAPABILITY").
List of parameters. Allowed types are and a byte array.

remarks.p:
The specified string parameters are send as is. It is caller's responsibility to properly format the parameters.
The specified byte array parameters are send as literals - binary blocks of data.
To use this method properly, some understanding of the IMAP protocol is strongly recommended.
A call to SendCommand MUST be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.
Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.ReadResponseAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous ReadResponse operation. Returns the response of the IMAP server to the command.

remarks.p: Use ReadResponse and SendCommand to implement various custom commands.
After a successful call to ReadResponse, the object will be in Reading state.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: Response of the IMAP server.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Imap.GetMessagesAsync(Rebex.Net.ImapMessageSet,Rebex.Net.ImapListFields,System.Action{Rebex.Net.ImapMessage},System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetMessages operation. Downloads messages in the current folder that belong to a specified message set.
member.param: A set of messages.
Specifies the scope of information to determine about each message.
A handler to process received messages. It has to process messages (and exit) quickly. If slow/complex processing is required, hand messages over to other thread.

remarks.para: Uses IMAP FETCH command to retrieve messages.
By default, this method marks messages as read. To prevent this behavior, set the to true.

This method demands a lot of data to be received from the server. The data has to be read from the network socket as fast as possible. This places demand on handler to process received messages as fast as possible. If the handler slows the process too much, incoming data will not be read from the underlying network socket in sufficient speed and TCP internal buffers will be overfilled. This can cause strange network exceptions.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Include all folders.

member.summary: Include subscribed folders only.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse
member.summary: Specifies special use flags for extended LIST command (RFC 6154) or XLIST extension.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.None
member.summary: No special use.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Inbox
member.summary: The folder is an inbox.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.All
member.summary: The folder presents all messages in the user's message store (with a possible exception of trash and junk mail). It is usually a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Archive
member.summary: The folder is used to archive messages.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Drafts
member.summary: The folder is used to hold draft messages - messages that are being composed but have not yet been sent.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Flagged
member.summary: The folder presents all messages marked in some way as 'important'. It is usually a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Junk
member.summary: The folder is where messages deemed to be junk (spam) mail are held.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Sent
member.summary: The folder is used to hold copies of messages that have been sent. Some server implementations might put messages here automatically.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Trash
member.summary: The folder is used to hold messages that have been deleted. Alternatively, it might be a virtual folder that presents messages marked for deletion.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.ImapFolderSpecialUse.Important
member.summary: The folder presents all messages marked by the server as 'important'. It is usually a virtual folder.

member.summary: Use BODY.PEEK instead of BODY in object's GetMessage, GetsMessageInfo, GetMailMessage, GetMimeMessage, GetMessageList and Search methods. Unlike BODY, BODY.PEEK doesn't set the message's Seen flag.

member.summary: Specifies whether to raise asynchronous events from the current working thread or whether to raise them using a available when an asynchronous operation was started.
member.value: False (default) to raise events using ; true to raise them directly form the current working thread.
member.remarks: Events of synchronous methods are always raised from the current working thread.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.ImapSettings.EnableKeywordCheck
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable FLAGS and PERMANENTFLAGS keyword check.
member.value: False (default) to disable keyword check; true to enable the keyword check.
member.remarks: The keyword check is disabled by default due to non-standard behavior of IMAP servers including GMail, FastMail and others that enable '[' and ']' in keywords.

member.summary: Use larger receive buffer for incoming and outgoing data.

member.summary: All message headers, sequence number, unique ID, length, flags and received date.

remarks.para: Same as , but also downloads complete message headers of each message.
This variant is the most verbose, but also the slowest, and in fact seldom needed, because nearly all interesting information about the message is already returned by .
